## Gini
```{r, def of function}
gini <- function(prob){
  1-(prob^2+(1-prob)^2)
}
```

Some values of the gini
```{r}
c(gini(1/4),gini(1/3),gini(1/2))
```

A plot of the Gini

```{r plot of gini curve, echo=FALSE}
curve(gini, from = 0, to = 1)
```

## Entropy

```{r}
entropy <-function(prob){
  -prob*log(prob)-(1-prob)*log(1-prob)
}
```

```{r, some values}
c(entropy(1/4),entropy(1/3),entropy(1/2))
```
```{r}
curve(entropy, from = 0, to = 1)
```

Try it in tidy too...
```{r}
library(ggplot2)

ggplot(data.frame(x = c(0, 1)), aes(x = x)) +
  stat_function(fun = entropy, geom = "line", color = "red") +
  stat_function(fun = gini, geom = "line", color = "blue")
```
